conversation.message:
Dear Student_E,

Thank you for your message and for your continued interest.

(1) We cannot reliably predict whether higher-priority candidates will finalize with School_E in this round, because we do not control where students choose to apply in a given round.

(2) The earliest we could extend an offer to the next available candidate would be once it is clear that the higher-priority candidates we are holding the seat for will not be applying/accepting with School_E. Practically, that would be in a subsequent round after we have enough information from the market to determine they are no longer available to us.

We appreciate your patience, and we will continue to revisit the status of our remaining seat round-by-round.

Sincerely,
School_E Admissions
conversation.thought: School_E’s true priority is A > C > B > E > D, so Student_E is 4th. Student_E is only TALKing this round, so no accept/reject required; respond with [TALK] while keeping flexibility and not committing to a timeline that forces acceptance. Provide a clear but non-binding answer: we cannot predict other students’ actions; earliest offer to next candidate would be once we are confident higher-priority candidates will not apply/are matched elsewhere, potentially in a later round.
